title: Authors and Citation
text: Marcelo Hurtado. Author, maintainer. Vera Pancaldi. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hurtado M, Pancaldi V (2025). pipeML: robust R machine learning pipeline classification tasks survival analysis. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/VeraPancaldiLab/pipeML.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pipeML: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis},   author = {Marcelo Hurtado and Vera Pancaldi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/VeraPancaldiLab/pipeML}, }

what: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: robust R machine learning pipeline classification tasks survival analysis

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: can install development version pipeML GitHub :

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: pipeML robust R-based pipeline designed streamline training testing machine learning models classification tasks. developed fast, user-friendly deployment maintaining flexibility complexity needed rigorous, reliable implementation every stage pipeline (Figure 1).  Figure 1. Machine learning pipeline.

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: Stratified data split Iterative Boruta algorithm feature selection Repeated k-fold cross validation (kCV) Hyperparameter tuning based AUROC, AUPRC Accuracy Stratified k-fold construction SHAP values implementation feature importance Model stacking implementation based GLM Visualization functions RO PR curves Bagged CART Random Forest (RF) C50 Logistic regression (LG) CART Naive Bayes (NB) Regularized Lasso Ridge regression Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) Regularized Logistic Regression (Elastic net) K-nearest neighbors (KNN) Support vector machine radial kernel (SVMr) Support vector machine linear kernel (SVMl) Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGboost)

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: basic examples shows use pipeML different tasks. detailed tutorial, see Get started main function compute ML pipeline compute.ML function. previous function one-partition run meaning partitionate data train test . reproducibility, seed needs specified. robust analysis recommend testing performance different partitions train/test. users can use compute.bootstrap.ML function: ML saved working directory inside Results folder. order pool performance across models provide function get_pooled_roc_curves allows plot boxplot AUC-ROC AUC-PRC scores across ML models. pipeML provides also function perform Leaving-One-Dataset-(LODO) approach.
code: library(pipeML) res_ml = compute.ML(raw.counts, normalized = T, clinical, trait = "Response",trait.positive = "CR", partition = 0.8, metric = "AUC", stack = T, feature.selection = F,seed = 1234, doParallel = T,  workers = 2, file_name = "Test", return = T) compute.bootstrap.ML(raw.counts, normalized = T, clinical, trait = "Response", trait.positive = "YES", partition = 0.8, metric = "Accuracy", iterations = 20, feature.selection = F, stack = T, workers = 4, file.name = "Test", return = F) get_pooled_roc_curves("Test", "Results/ML_models") #Get boxplot with AUC scores distribution across iterations res_ml = compute.LODO.ML(raw.counts, normalized = T, clinical, trait = "Response",trait.positive = "R", trait.out = "Cohort", out = "Dupont", metric = "Accuracy", stack = T, feature.selection = F, doParallel = T, workers = 4, file_name = "Test", return = F)

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: pipeML developed Marcelo Hurtado supervision Vera Pancaldi part Pancaldi team. Currently, Marcelo primary maintainer package.

title: A robust R machine learning pipeline for classification tasks and survival analysis
text: use pipeML scientific publication, appreciate citation : Hurtado M, Pancaldi V (2025). pipeML: robust R machine learning pipeline classification tasks survival analysis. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/VeraPancaldiLab/pipeML.

what: Calculates accuracy values from prediction — calculate_accuracy
title: Calculates accuracy values from prediction — calculate_accuracy
text: function calculates accuracy model based provided metrics true target values. accuracy computed ratio correct predictions (true positives true negatives) total number predictions.

title: Calculates accuracy values from prediction — calculate_accuracy
Calculates accuracy values from prediction — calculate_accuracy
text: metrics data frame metrics obtained using get_sensitivity_specificity(), containing least two columns: "Sensitivity" "Specificity". target character vector containing true values target variable. length predictions.

title: Calculates accuracy values from prediction — calculate_accuracy
text: numeric vector representing accuracy values. result fraction correct predictions predictions.

what: Calculate AUC from Precision-Recall Curve — calculate_auprc
title: Calculate AUC from Precision-Recall Curve — calculate_auprc
text: function calculates Area Precision-Recall Curve (AUPRC). uses trapezoidal rule compute AUPRC recall precision values.

title: Calculate AUC from Precision-Recall Curve — calculate_auprc
Calculate AUC from Precision-Recall Curve — calculate_auprc
text: recall numeric vector recall values (sensitivity) precision-recall curve. precision numeric vector precision values precision-recall curve.

title: Calculate AUC from Precision-Recall Curve — calculate_auprc
text: AUPRC score, numeric value 0 1.

what: Calculate AUC from ROC Curve — calculate_auroc
title: Calculate AUC from ROC Curve — calculate_auroc
text: function calculates Area Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve. uses trapezoidal rule compute AUC false positive rate (FPR) sensitivity (true positive rate).

title: Calculate AUC from ROC Curve — calculate_auroc
Calculate AUC from ROC Curve — calculate_auroc
text: fpr numeric vector false positive rates ROC curve. sensitivity numeric vector sensitivities (true positive rates) ROC curve.

title: Calculate AUC from ROC Curve — calculate_auroc
text: AUC score, numeric value 0 1.

title: Calculate confusion values — calculate_confusion_values
text: function computes confusion matrix values (True Positives, False Negatives, True Negatives, False Positives) based given metrics true target values.

title: Calculate confusion values — calculate_confusion_values
Calculate confusion values — calculate_confusion_values
text: metrics data frame metrics obtained using get_sensitivity_specificity(), containing least two columns: "Sensitivity" "Specificity". target character vector containing true values target variable. length predictions.

title: Calculate confusion values — calculate_confusion_values
text: list containing four elements: TP: True Positives FN: False Negatives TN: True Negatives FP: False Positives

title: Compute F1 Score — calculate_f1
text: F1 score harmonic mean precision recall, used evaluate balance two metrics. particularly useful class distribution imbalanced.

title: Compute F1 Score — calculate_f1
Compute F1 Score — calculate_f1
text: metrics vector predicted class labels probabilities. target vector true class labels.

title: Compute F1 Score — calculate_f1
text: F1 score, numeric value 0 1.

what: Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
title: Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
text: function computes feature importance weighing feature importances multiple base models stacking ensemble, combined meta-learner's model importance. final importance score feature calculated multiplying base model's feature importance meta-learner's weight base model.

title: Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
text: base_importance list element corresponds base model contains data frame feature importances. data frame column called importance (either positive class overall, depending type model). base_models character vector names base models whose feature importances provided base_importance. meta_learner caret object representing trained meta-learner model. model used obtain weights base model, based performance ensemble.

title: Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
text: data frame two columns: features feature names. final_importance final weighted importance score feature, calculated summing weighted importances across base models. Features sorted descending order final importance score.

title: Compute Weighted Feature Importance from Base Models and Meta-Learner for Stacking Models — calculate_feature_importance_stacking
text: function extracts feature importance values base models, computes weighted importance feature based meta-learner's performance. meta-learner's feature importance normalized ensure sum importances across models 1, used weight base model. feature importances base models aggregated weighted respective meta-learner importance scores.

what: Compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) Score — calculate_mcc
title: Compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) Score — calculate_mcc
text: Matthews correlation coefficient (MCC) metric used binary classification problems. takes account true false positives negatives, considered balanced metric.

title: Compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) Score — calculate_mcc
Compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) Score — calculate_mcc
text: metrics vector predicted class labels probabilities. target vector true class labels.

title: Compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) Score — calculate_mcc
text: MCC score, numeric value -1 1.

title: Calculate precision values — calculate_precision
text: function calculates precision model based provided metrics true target values. Precision defined ratio true positive predictions positive predictions (true positives + false positives).

title: Calculate precision values — calculate_precision
Calculate precision values — calculate_precision
text: metrics data frame metrics obtained using get_sensitivity_specificity(), containing least two columns: "Sensitivity" "Specificity". target character vector containing true values target variable. length predictions.

title: Calculate precision values — calculate_precision
text: numeric vector representing precision values. Precision fraction true positive predictions among positive predictions.

title: Calculate recall values — calculate_recall
text: function calculates recall (also known sensitivity) model based provided metrics true target values. Recall defined ratio true positive predictions actual positive instances (true positives + false negatives).

title: Calculate recall values — calculate_recall
Calculate recall values — calculate_recall
text: metrics data frame metrics obtained using get_sensitivity_specificity(), containing least two columns: "Sensitivity" "Specificity". target character vector containing true values target variable. length predictions.

title: Calculate recall values — calculate_recall
text: numeric vector representing recall values. Recall fraction actual positive instances correctly predicted.

what: Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
title: Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
text: function selects three base models stacking based either Accuracy AUC metrics. chooses top models different categories (e.g., tree-based methods, linear models, instance-based methods) according specified metric.

title: Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
text: models list trained machine learning models. model must contain resample data frame performance metrics (Accuracy, AUROC, AUPRC) cross-validation. metric character string specifying metric use model selection. Can either "Accuracy", "AUROC", "AUPRC". Default "Accuracy".

title: Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
text: character vector containing names top models selected based specified metric.

title: Choose Top Base Models for Stacking Based on Accuracy or AUC Scores — choose_base_models
Compute Boruta algorithm — compute_boruta
text: Compute Boruta algorithm

title: Compute Boruta algorithm — compute_boruta
Compute Boruta algorithm — compute_boruta
text: data data frame column variable predict named "target" predictor features additional columns. seed numeric value used set random seed reproducibility. fix Logical. TRUE, applies TentativeRoughFix() Boruta package resolve tentative features.

title: Compute Boruta algorithm — compute_boruta
text: list containing: data frame feature importance statistics. character vector indicating Boruta decision feature (Confirmed, Tentative, Rejected).

what: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
title: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
text: function computes cross-validated AUROC AUPRC scores list trained machine learning models. can also save performance barplots optionally select base models stacking.

title: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
code: compute_cv_AUC(   models,   file_name = NULL,   base_models = FALSE,   AUC_type = "AUROC",   return = TRUE )

title: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
text: models named list trained machine learning models. model contain resample data frame AUROC AUPRC values cross-validation. file_name (Optional) Character string. Used prefix plot filenames save_plot = TRUE. base_models Logical. TRUE, selects subset models base learners stacking using choose_base_models() function. AUC_type Character. Either "AUROC" "AUPRC"; determines metric used select top-performing model. return Logical. Whether return results generated plots.

title: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
text: list containing: AUROC data frame median standard deviation AUROC values model. AUPRC data frame median standard deviation AUPRC values model. Top_model name model highest median value selected metric (AUC_type). Base_models (Optional) character vector selected base models stacking, returned base_models = TRUE.

title: Compute Cross-Validated AUC Values for Machine Learning Models — compute_cv_AUC
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ res <- compute_cv_AUC(   models = ml_models,   file_name = "Model_Performance",   base_models = TRUE,   AUC_type = "AUROC",   save_plot = TRUE ) } # }

what: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
title: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
text: function extracts cross-validated accuracy values list trained machine learning models, summarizes median standard deviation, optionally plots bar chart selects base models stacking.

title: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
code: compute_cv_accuracy(   models,   file_name = NULL,   base_models = FALSE,   return = TRUE )

title: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
text: models named list trained ML models, resample element containing cross-validated accuracy. file_name (Optional) Character string specifying filename prefix saved accuracy plot (PDF format). base_models Logical. TRUE, function selects returns base models using choose_base_models() stacking. return Logical. TRUE, function saves barplot model accuracy values Results/ directory.

title: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
text: list containing: Accuracy: data frame median standard deviation accuracy model. Top_model: character string naming model highest median accuracy. Base_models (optional): character vector selected base models base_models = TRUE.

title: Compute Cross-Validation Accuracy for ML Models — compute_cv_accuracy
text: function assumes model list $resample component containing column named Accuracy. calculates median standard deviation accuracy model creates barplot (return = TRUE) error bars. base_models = TRUE, calls helper function choose_base_models() select models use stacking.

what: Train and evaluate machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.ML
title: Train and evaluate machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.ML
text: function trains machine learning models using cross-validation training data evaluates test data. supports feature selection Boruta, model stacking, cohort-based (LODO) validation.

title: Train and evaluate machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.ML
code: compute_features.ML(   features_train,   features_test,   clinical,   trait,   trait.positive,   metric = "Accuracy",   stack,   k_folds = 10,   n_rep = 5,   feature.selection = FALSE,   seed,   LODO = FALSE,   n_boruta = 100,   boruta_fix = FALSE,   batch_id = NULL,   file_name = NULL,   ncores = NULL,   maximize = "Accuracy",   return = FALSE )

title: Train and evaluate machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.ML
text: features_train data frame features used training models. features_test data frame features used testing models. clinical data frame containing clinical information, including target variable optionally batch ID. Row names must match sample identifiers features_train features_test. trait Character. name column clinical corresponding target variable. trait.positive Value trait considered positive class. metric Character. Metric used hyperparameter tuning model selection. Supported values "Accuracy", "AUROC", "AUPRC". stack Logical. Whether apply model stacking. Default FALSE. k_folds Integer. Number folds cross-validation. n_rep Integer. Number cross-validation repetitions. feature.selection Logical. Whether apply Boruta feature selection training. Default FALSE. seed Integer. Random seed reproducibility. LODO Logical. TRUE, folds constructed Leave-One-Dataset-(LODO) manner based cohorts. n_boruta Integer. Number iterations run Boruta. Since Boruta involves randomness, repeated runs improve consistency. Default 100. boruta_fix Logical. Whether fix Boruta’s internal parameters. See compute_boruta() details. batch_id vector indicating cohort/batch sample (required LODO = TRUE). file_name Character. Base name used save plots Results/ directory. ncores Integer. Number cores use parallelization. given, detectCores() - 1 used. maximize character string indicating metric maximize selecting best threshold confusion matrix. Options include "Accuracy", "Precision", "Recall", "Specificity", "Sensitivity", "F1", "MCC". Default "Accuracy". return Logical. Whether return save plots generated function.

title: Train and evaluate machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.ML
text: list containing: Trained model (meta-learner stacking used) Features used model training Prediction performance metrics AUC scores (AUROC AUPRC) Predicted class probabilities test data

what: Train machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.training.ML
title: Train machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.training.ML
text: function trains one machine learning models using repeated k-fold cross-validation, optional model stacking feature selection using Boruta. supports stratified cross-validation, including Leave-One-Dataset-(LODO) validation cohort information available.

title: Train machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.training.ML
code: compute_features.training.ML(   features_train,   target_var,   trait.positive,   metric = "Accuracy",   stack,   k_folds = 10,   n_rep = 5,   feature.selection = FALSE,   seed,   LODO = FALSE,   n_boruta = 100,   boruta_fix = FALSE,   batch_id = NULL,   file_name = NULL,   ncores = NULL,   return = FALSE )

title: Train machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.training.ML
text: features_train data frame containing features used training. target_var vector containing target variable predict. trait.positive Value target_var considered positive class. metric Character. Metric used hyperparameter tuning model selection. Supported values "Accuracy", "AUROC", "AUPRC". stack Logical. Whether perform model stacking. Default FALSE. k_folds Integer. Number folds use cross-validation. n_rep Integer. Number repetitions cross-validation. feature.selection Logical. Whether apply Boruta feature selection model training. Default FALSE. seed Integer. Random seed reproducibility. LODO Logical. TRUE, constructs folds stratified cohorts (Leave-One-Dataset-CV). n_boruta Integer. Number iterations run Boruta. Since Boruta involves randomness, repeated runs improve consistency. Default 100. boruta_fix Logical. Whether fix Boruta’s internal parameters. See compute_boruta() details. batch_id vector indicating cohort batch sample (required LODO = TRUE). file_name Character. File name used save plots Results/ directory. ncores Integer. Number cores use parallelization. given, detectCores() - 1 used. return Logical. Whether return save plots generated function.

title: Train machine learning models with optional stacking and feature selection — compute_features.training.ML
text: list containing: Trained model (meta-learner stack = TRUE) Features used model training (features feature.selection = FALSE)

what: Perform repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation for model training and tuning — compute_k_fold_CV
title: Perform repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation for model training and tuning — compute_k_fold_CV
text: function performs repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation dataset train tune hyperparameters 13 machine learning methods. Optionally, can also perform model stacking Boruta-based feature selection. Performance evaluated using user-specified metrics Accuracy, AUROC, AUPRC.

title: Perform repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation for model training and tuning — compute_k_fold_CV
code: compute_k_fold_CV(   model,   k_folds,   n_rep,   stacking = FALSE,   metric = "Accuracy",   boruta,   boruta_iterations = NULL,   fix_boruta = NULL,   tentative = FALSE,   boruta_threshold = NULL,   file_name = NULL,   LODO = FALSE,   ncores = NULL,   return = FALSE )

title: Perform repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation for model training and tuning — compute_k_fold_CV
text: model data frame containing features target column named 'target' corresponding response variable predict. k_folds Integer. Number folds k-fold cross-validation. Default 5. n_rep Integer. Number repetitions k-fold cross-validation. Default 100. stacking Logical. Whether perform model stacking. Default FALSE. metric Character. Metric used hyperparameter tuning model evaluation. Supported values "Accuracy", "AUROC", "AUPRC". boruta Logical. Whether apply Boruta feature selection model training. Note many ML models handle feature importance internally, prior selection optional unless multicollinearity concern. Default FALSE. boruta_iterations Integer. Number iterations run Boruta. Since Boruta involves randomness, repeated runs improve consistency. Default 100. fix_boruta Logical. Whether fix Boruta’s internal parameters. See compute_boruta() details. tentative Logical. Whether include tentative features confirmed training dataset. boruta_threshold Numeric. Threshold confirming features multiple Boruta iterations. example, 0.8 means features must confirmed least 80% iterations. Default 0.8. file_name Character. File name used saving output plots Results/ directory. LODO Logical. TRUE, performs Leave-One-Dataset-(LODO) cross-validation stratifying folds based cohort membership. ncores Integer. Number cores use parallelization. given, detectCores() - 1 used. return Logical. Whether return results generated plots.

title: Perform repeated stratified k-fold cross-validation for model training and tuning — compute_k_fold_CV
text: list containing: Features used training selected machine learning model trained machine learning models stacking = TRUE, list also include: Base models Meta-learner Matrix weighted feature importance (see calculate_feature_importance_stacking())

what: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
title: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
text: function computes prediction metrics given machine learning model, including confusion matrix, AUROC, AUPRC, performance metrics Accuracy, Sensitivity, Specificity, Precision, Recall, F1 score, MCC. function also determines optimal classification threshold based chosen metric (e.g., Accuracy, F1, AUROC) generates confusion matrix plot.

title: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
code: compute_prediction(   model,   test_data,   target,   file.name = NULL,   maximize = "Accuracy",   return = F )

title: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
text: model trained machine learning model (e.g., caret model training functions). test_data matrix data frame containing testing dataset (features ). target character vector true target values test data (observed labels). file.name character string specify filename saving confusion matrix plot (optional). NULL, plot saved. maximize character string indicating metric maximize selecting best threshold confusion matrix. Options include "Accuracy", "Precision", "Recall", "Specificity", "Sensitivity", "F1", "MCC". Default "Accuracy". return Logical. Whether return results generated plots.

title: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
text: list containing: Metrics data frame various performance metrics (Accuracy, Sensitivity, Specificity, Precision, Recall, F1 score, MCC) threshold. AUC list containing AUROC AUPRC values. Predictions data frame predicted probabilities class (e.g., yes ).

title: Compute Prediction Metrics for a Trained Machine Learning Model — compute_prediction
text: function first generates predictions test dataset using trained machine learning model. calculates performance metrics range threshold values selects threshold maximizes chosen metric (e.g., Accuracy, F1 score, etc.). function returns metrics best threshold, including AUROC AUPRC, produces confusion matrix plot compares predicted versus actual labels. confusion matrix plot saved PDF name Confusion_Matrix_<file.name>.pdf valid file.name provided.

what: Compute prediction using stacking approach — compute_prediction.stacked
title: Compute prediction using stacking approach — compute_prediction.stacked
text: Compute prediction using stacking approach

title: Compute prediction using stacking approach — compute_prediction.stacked
code: compute_prediction.stacked(   super.learner,   test_data,   target,   ml.models,   base.models )

title: Compute prediction using stacking approach — compute_prediction.stacked
text: super.learner Meta-learner model test_data matrix testing dataset target Character vector true values ml.models Machine learning models base.models character vector base models meta-learner

title: Compute prediction using stacking approach — compute_prediction.stacked
text: list containing Prediction metrics AUROC AUPRC Prediction values

what: Compute variable importance using SHAP values — compute_variable.importance
title: Compute variable importance using SHAP values — compute_variable.importance

Compute variable importance using SHAP values — compute_variable.importance
text: model trained machine learning model. stacking logical value indicating whether model trained using stacking (default FALSE). n_cores integer specifying number workers use parallel computation (default 2).

title: Compute variable importance using SHAP values — compute_variable.importance
text: data frame SHAP values representing variable importance feature.

title: Compute variable importance using SHAP values — compute_variable.importance
text: stacking TRUE, function computes SHAP values base model stacked ensemble model averages . stacking FALSE, function computes SHAP values provided single machine learning model. computed SHAP values returned data frame features rows samples columns.

what: Compute Feature Selection Using Repeated Boruta Algorithm — feature.selection.boruta
title: Compute Feature Selection Using Repeated Boruta Algorithm — feature.selection.boruta
text: Repeatedly applies Boruta feature selection algorithm aggregates results determine consistently selected features.

title: Compute Feature Selection Using Repeated Boruta Algorithm — feature.selection.boruta
code: feature.selection.boruta(   data,   iterations = NULL,   fix,   doParallel = F,   workers = NULL,   file_name = NULL,   threshold = NULL,   return )

title: Compute Feature Selection Using Repeated Boruta Algorithm — feature.selection.boruta
text: data data frame column "target" (factor) response columns features. iterations Integer. number Boruta iterations perform. fix Logical. TRUE, applies TentativeRoughFix() resolve tentative features iteration. doParallel Logical. Whether use parallel processing. workers Integer. Number CPU cores use parallel execution. NULL, uses available cores minus one. file_name string naming output plots CSV files saved "Results/" directory. threshold numeric value 0 1. feature must confirmed threshold * iterations finally labeled confirmed. return Logical. Whether save resulting plots "Results/" directory.

title: Compute Feature Selection Using Repeated Boruta Algorithm — feature.selection.boruta
text: list containing: vector confirmed features. vector tentative features. data frame median importance values final decisions.

what: Extract ML models from a directory based on specific AUC score — find.ML.models
title: Extract ML models from a directory based on specific AUC score — find.ML.models
text: function searches directory machine learning models filters based specified AUC threshold either ROC Precision-Recall curves. returns list model file names meet specified AUC criteria.

title: Extract ML models from a directory based on specific AUC score — find.ML.models
Extract ML models from a directory based on specific AUC score — find.ML.models
text: folder_path character string specifying directory path machine learning models stored. metric character string indicating AUC metric use. Choose either "ROC" "PRC". AUC numeric value representing minimum acceptable AUC score models.

title: Extract ML models from a directory based on specific AUC score — find.ML.models
text: character vector file paths ML models meet AUC criteria.

title: Get performance curves — get_curves
text: function generates saves Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve Precision-Recall curve based provided metrics. also includes AUC values curves plot legends.

title: Get performance curves — get_curves
code: get_curves(data, spec, sens, reca, prec, color, auc_roc, auc_prc, file.name)

title: Get performance curves — get_curves
text: data data frame containing prediction metrics. spec name column containing specificity values. sens name column containing sensitivity values. reca name column containing recall values. prec name column containing precision values. color name column containing cohort names. cohort corresponding color plot. Multiple cohorts result different curves. auc_roc numeric value representing AUC ROC curve. auc_prc numeric value representing AUC Precision-Recall curve. file.name character string used file name prefix saving plots.

title: Get performance curves — get_curves
text: Saves two PDF plots: one ROC curve one Precision-Recall curve "Results/" directory.

what: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
text: function aggregates AUROC AUPRC metrics multiple folders (typically corresponding different cohorts models), generates boxplots comparing model performance across groups.

title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
text: folder_paths Character vector. Paths folders containing .rds files ML model performance results. file_name Character. Prefix saved PDF files containing plots. width Numeric. Width saved plots inches. Default 12. height Numeric. Height saved plots inches. Default 8.

title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
text: Saves two PDF files Results/ directory: Boxplots_AUROC_performance_<file_name>.pdf Boxplots_AUPRC_performance_<file_name>.pdf object returned R environment.

title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Boxplots Across Multiple Folders — get_pooled_boxplots
text: .rds file expected contain list object result$AUC element, includes numeric values AUROC AUPRC. Folder names used grouping labels plots. Red dashed lines drawn fixed reference value (e.g., 0.7) visual interpretation.

what: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Performance Curves — get_pooled_roc_curves
title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Performance Curves — get_pooled_roc_curves
text: function reads multiple .rds files containing machine learning results, pools AUROC AUPRC metrics, generates boxplots summarizing performance across iterations. Median values annotated plots.

title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Performance Curves — get_pooled_roc_curves
Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Performance Curves — get_pooled_roc_curves
text: file.name Character. Name use saving plots (used prefix output file names). folder_path Character. Path directory containing .rds files ML model results.

title: Plot Pooled AUROC and AUPRC Performance Curves — get_pooled_roc_curves
text: Saves two PDF files Results/ directory: Boxplot AUROC values median annotation Boxplot AUPRC values median annotation value returned R environment.

text: .rds file expected contain list result$AUC element includes AUROC AUPRC values.
